str2: A robber, brigand, bandit. From leizomai; a brigand.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Plural
str2: From stauros; to impale on the cross; figuratively, to extinguish passion or selfishness.
With. A primary preposition denoting union; with or together.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
One. (including the neuter Hen); a primary numeral; one.
From out, out from among, from, suggesting from the interior outwards. A primary preposition denoting origin, from, out.
On the right hand, right hand, right. From dechomai; the right side or hand.
One. (including the neuter Hen); a primary numeral; one.
From out, out from among, from, suggesting from the interior outwards. A primary preposition denoting origin, from, out.
From eu and onoma; properly, well-named, i.e. The left; neuter as adverbial, at the left hand.
